info.description:
==================
 What is RunLens?
==================

RunLens is an alternative for the application lens that is used in
Ubuntu's Unity desktop to start applications.

RunLens doesn't show "*Apps available for Download*" and "*Most
Frequently used*" sections. Instead it only lists installed
applications sorted by relevancy to the search query.

In addition to the program's name and icon it shows a short
description for every application.

========
 Get it
========

RunLens ist available at `<http://www.florian-diesch.de/software/runlens/>`_


========
 Status
========

RunLens is  Alpha software. It works for me but I 
expect it to have quite some bugs.  **Use it at your own risk.**

If you find a bug in RunLens please report it at the `bugtracker at
Launchpad <https://bugs.launchpad.net/runlens/+filebug>`_ so that I
can fix it. Thank you.


============
Requirements
============

RunLens is developed and tested on Ubuntu 11.10 "Oneiric Ocelot"

RunLens needs the following packages from the software sources:

- python-gmenu 
- python-gobject
- python-whoosh

If you install the .deb package this packages will be automatically
installed if needed.
